sermons.title: A Call For Leaders In Nepal by Bhuvan Devkota (nepalese)
A Clean Heart by Andrew Strom
A Desperate Hour Calls For A Radical Response by Brian Long
A Keen Awareness Of The Church's Loss by Roger Ellsworth
sermons.description: Roger Ellsworth speaks passionately about the desperate state of the Church. His sermon covers three aspects of the Isaiah scripture: A keen awareness of loss, A keen awareness of what produced the loss, A keen awareness that God could restore what was lost. True God sent revival is actual and possible in our days if we will humble ourselves as the people of God.

sermons.title: A New Call To Arms by David Legge
A Revival Of God's Word by Jose Muniz
A Revival Of Honesty by Richard Sipley
A Revival Of Humility by Kevin Turner
A Revival Of Poverty by Derek Melton
sermons.description: Brother Melton captures the essence of biblical/historical revival and those who would seek it in this message. Drawing amply from the scriptures, he paints a portrait of the revival spirit in its simplicity and pureness. He delivers with passion and brokenness as he accurately identifies the single reason why we do not see revival in our day. Listen, find out, be transformed.

sermons.title: A Revival Of The Cross by Randy Jones
Bringing A New Thing To Birth by Alan Bartley
Brokenness, A Prerequisite To Answered Prayer by Mark Greening
Busyness And Spiritual Discipline by Paul Washer
Casting Your Eye On Sodom by Walid Bitar
Compromising Christianity by Keith Daniel
sermons.description: Keith Daniel shares with earnestness the single greatest tragedy the world faces today which is "compromising Christianity." The sermon speaks of sins that Christians commit with their ears, mouth, mind and heart. He calls the congregation to break up their fallow ground and repent from any known sin.

sermons.title: Dealing With Sin by Charles Price
sermons.description: Charles Price delivers a very sobering message on the danger of sin in the Christian life and ministry. He shares the account of Saul and how sin came back to haunt him and took him from kingship. May we be at war with sin in our Christian Life and never excuse sin in any way.

sermons.title: Dividing Brothers Hinders Personal Revival by Alan Martin
Dynamic Holy Hunger by Wesley Duewel
Giving All For Revival by Denny Kenaston
God Requires Integrity In All Our Dealings With Money! by Keith Daniel
God's New Thing by David Legge
sermons.description: David Legge shares his burden about what God is doing in now and will be doing in revival in the future. This message is prophetic and carries with it a great weight about the true reality of a move of God and the biblical implications. This is a very important message for the times we are living in as the body of Christ.

sermons.title: Heartfelt Prayer for Revival by George Verwer
Humble Yourselves by Richard Owen Roberts
Ichabod Or Ebenezer? by Charles Price
John The Baptist Revival by David Guzik
Just Following Jesus by K.P. Yohannan
sermons.description: K.P. Yohannan shares very personally and intimately about following Jesus Christ authentically in our lifes. He shares some stories from his ministry and walk with Christ over the last 40 years. And he also shares the example of Jesus Christ for us to follow.

sermons.title: Let Me Not See My Wretchedness by Carter Conlon
sermons.description: Carter Conlon delivers a very powerful message on the great need for personal revival in these last days. We need to realize our great need to confess our sinfulness and the need for the righteousness of Christ. We can only be agents of revival and be filled with Christ when we fully surrender to God.

sermons.title: Loving Sin More Then Jesus by Mark Greening
Man-Made Ministry by Will Graham
Nothing Moves Me by Don McClure
Nothing Without Faith by David Legge
Personal Revival by Ron Bailey
sermons.description: Ron Bailey from the United Kingdom shares his heart burden for personal revival from the life of David. He carefully and gracefully goes through Psalm 51 and shows how God revives His own. How we need personal revival and to come and acknowledge when God speaks.

sermons.title: Ploughman And The Reaper by David Guzik
Question & Answer Panel Atlanta
Question And Answer Panel
Question And Answer Panel Canton
sermons.description: 7 speakers from the conference are asked many questions by the audience and also by the moderator Gareth Evans. The panel included the following speakers, Denny Kenaston, Don Currin, Ralph Sutera, Richard Sipley, Dean Taylor, Ron Bailey, Don Courville.

sermons.title: Question Answer Panel
Question Answer Panel
Question/Answer Panel Greenock
Rend the Heavens and Come Down  by Wesley Duewel
Revival A Return To Holiness by Richard Sipley
Revival According to John by Denny Kenaston
sermons.description: Revival is Christ is the central message of Denny Kenaston's sermon, "Revival According to John," delivered October 23, 2008 at the Atlanta Revival Conference.  After hearing Paul Washer's "Ten Indictments," I wondered what God would have me do, and Denny delivered God's suggestions, taken from the apostle John's first letter.  In a dynamic, interesting, and thought-provoking manner, Denny defines revival, and illustrates how revival should be our normal experience.  "Ten Indictments" and "Revival According to John" are two very powerful words needed in our church today, and as the apostle Paul and the early church father James stand back to back and look at both sides of faith and works, Paul Washer and Denny Kenaston give us a divinely-balanced approach to understanding the revival and reformation God desires in His people today.

sermons.title: Revival And Confession Of Sin by David Guzik
Revival In Lewis Testimony by Mary Peckham
Revival In The Land by Al Whittinghill
Revival In The Life Of Abraham by Don McClure
Revival Is Possible by Colin Peckham
Revival Testimonies by Don Courville
sermons.description: Don Courville shares his heart and experience with God in revival. To hear these testimonies of what God has done stirs the heart towards experiencing God in a greater way. Revival is the only solution for the Church, to have God Himself in the midst.

sermons.title: Revival and the Economy by Edgar Reich
Revival: A New Wineskin by Trevor N Vosloo
Revivals Apostolic Pattern by Ron Bailey
Revivals In The Bible by Dean Taylor
sermons.description: Dean Taylor speaks of revivals in the bible in the new testament and old testament histories. This overview is very helpful to give us some clear biblical landmarks to seek God for biblical genuine revival in our day.

sermons.title: Rivers of Living Water by Bill McCleod
Satanic Warfare: The Road To Revival by Keith Daniel
sermons.description: Keith Daniel delivers a stirring message of the true reality of the satanic warfare that has been going on for the entire existence of mankind. May we hear and truly enter into this warfare in prayer on our knees. May God open our eyes to this reality amongst us.

sermons.title: Show Me Your Glory by Gareth Evans
sermons.description: Gareth Evans shares many testimonies of revival experiences in his life. And it culminates in the passionate plea to God "show me your glory." This is the hunger that all true christians yearn for ultimately. God has a place of glory and overcoming life in the spirit filled holy life.

sermons.title: Ten Indictments Against The Modern Church by Paul Washer
sermons.description: Paul Washer delivers a urgent appeal to the Christians and Churches in North America that many have been believing a false gospel and have false assurance of their salvation. He lists 10 indictments against the modern Church system in America. This is a historical urgent message, tell others and spread the message. We need a reformation and revival of a biblical standard!

sermons.title: The Breaking Heart Of God by Clayton Dougan
sermons.description: Clayton Dougan shares a powerful message on the broken heart of God over His Church. That God's heart is breaking for a backslidden bride that is flirting with the world. This message is a deep burdened call to true revival in our day.

sermons.title: The Bridegroom Is Coming by Keith Daniel
The Canadian Revival Story by Ralph Sutera
sermons.description: Ralph Sutera shares his first hand account of the revival that occoured in the 70's in canada. He shares some wonderful revival principles he learnt throughout his years and challenges the congregation to quit playing games with God and get serious about eternity.

sermons.title: The Crisis Of Contemporary Christianity by Andrew Strom
The Cross And Revival Al Whittinghill
sermons.description: This sermon was titled: "The cross and revival" and was preached at the Greenock Revival Conference. True revival always has preaching of the Cross and the Word of God. Revival is the Cross of Jesus Christ in full effect in the Believers life.

sermons.title: The Danger Of Complacency Don Currin
sermons.description: Don Currin preaches a sermon on the topic of "complacency" that really points to a modern day christianity that does not live in the live and reality of God. This is a sobering warning to the Church of Jesus Christ. This is a wake up call to Church in North America.

sermons.title: The Forgiveness Of God by Roger Ellsworth
The Glory Is Departed by Harold Vaughn
sermons.description: Harold Vaughn speaks of great need of revival and the declension of the nation of Israel under the priesthood of Eli. There is a similarity between the story found in 1st Samuel and the current state of America spiritually. This message gives a clear call for repentance for the Church of Jesus Christ.

sermons.title: The Glory Of God Departing by Brian Long
The Great Need Of Revival by Denny Kenaston
sermons.description: Denny Kenaston opens the revival conference with a exhortation to seek the face of God, to see what God can do! He shares the burden and reason why revival is very needful in our day. Then he preaches verse by verse through psalm 80 asking God to restore his church to God.

sermons.title: The Holy Presence Of God by Yorrie Richards
sermons.description: Yorrie speaks in this message of the character of God namely His holiness. And not just an abstract message but it speaks of our experiencing of this holy God. This is a crucial message for modern Christianity, this was spoken on the 50th year of ministry of brother Yorrie at the Moriah Chapel in Wales.

sermons.title: The Instrument God Uses by John Macgregor
The Lost Gospel by Paul Washer
The Necessity Of A Pure Conscience And Revival by Al Whittinghill
sermons.description: This sermon is titled: "The necessity of a pure conscience and revival." Brother Al Whittinghill shares the burden of his heart on the conscience as it relates to revival and purity of heart. Before God works in outer visible glory, he works in the inner man of the believer in the heart.

sermons.title: The Overwhelming Presence Of God by Yorrie Richards
The Power of Travailing Prayer by Mark Greening
sermons.description: This message delivered by Mark Greening is a powerful exhortation to true prayer and intercession that brings revival. With testimonies of God working just months before and examples of church history of such praying. With many scriptures given to substantiate this type of praying we are helpless but to say we have not such a conception of praying in our day. Oh may we humble ourselves and let our Master teach us afresh what it means to "travail."

sermons.title: The Welsh Revival by Dyfrig Griffiths
The Wrath Of God by Don Currin
Walking With The Presence Of God by Francois Carr
Watching Joseph Die by Bill Mcleod
sermons.description: Bill McLeod has taken part in revivals for over thirty years. He has traveled extensively and experienced the power of God in revival throughout Canada, the United States, South America, and Europe. For the last twenty years he has passionately led crusades and revivals, sharing the engrossing truths the Lord has given him. He shares his burden for revival through the story of Joseph from the scriptures.

sermons.title: What Is Christianity by Paul Washer
What Is Revival by David Legge
When Revival Does Not Come by Don Currin
Worldliness by Richard Sipley
sermons.description: Richard Sipley shows how in revival worldliness in the Christian life is dealt with by God. He clearly defines a biblical new testament view of what worldliness is from the teachings of Jesus and the Apostles. He shares many testimonies of what God did in his life and during his ministry.
